entry.def: Halfway means in the middle of a place or between two points, at an equal distance from each of them.

example.ex: Half-way across the car-park, he noticed she was walking with her eyes closed...
example.tran: 走到停车场中间时，他看到她在闭着眼走路。

example.ex: He was halfway up the ladder...

entry.tran: （时间）到一半;（事情）进行到中途
entry.def: Halfway means in the middle of a period of time or of an event.

example.ex: By then, it was October and we were more than halfway through our tour.
example.tran: 那时已是10月，我们已经完成了行程的一大半了。

entry.def: If you meet someone halfway, you accept some of the points they are making so that you can come to an agreement with them.

example.ex: The Democrats are willing to meet the president halfway.
example.tran: 民主党人愿意向总统作部分让步。

example.ex: You need hard currency to get anything halfway decent...
example.tran: 你得有硬通货才能买到还算不错的东西。

example.ex: All I had to do was be halfway cool.
example.tran: 我要做的只是保持适度的冷静。

sentences.en: We’re opening several halfway houses for people who’ve been in this hospital.
sentences.cn: 我们打算为这家医院里的病人开几家过渡疗养所。

sentences.en: We really wanted to build a completely new hospital, but we didn’t have the money, so this extension is a kind of halfway house.
sentences.cn: 我们非常想新建一所医院，但是没钱，扩建算是折中方案吧。
